sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The level 3 of translations groups together packages which prompt users during the installation of the desktop and desktop tasks of tasksel.
Given its great importance in a localized desktop system, the menu package (menu sections) has been added to this list.

This includes the following Debian packages:
menu
xorg
exim4

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The menu Debian package provides all window managers, in graphical environments, a standard menu to organize the applications launch shortcuts.
The most important items to translate in menu are the menu section names.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses a CVS repository.
This package's localization material is spread over two files. These are, by order of importance:

listitem.para: po/*.po: program translations. The maintainers unfortunately do not keep a templates file in their repositories, so translators should pick up another PO file as a reference to create their own translation file.
po-sections/po/menu-sections.pot: names of the menu sections, which group together the shortcuts for the various programs.
CVS access: &cvs-menu;, po-sections directory (menu sections translations) and po-sections directory (program translations)

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the menu package.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The xorg Debian package provides the X-Window System environment which is by far the most common graphical environment of Unix systems.
This package is installed on all desktop systems. It asks, during its installation several questions to users about their hardware, in order to properly setup the X server configuration file.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses a SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the xorg package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The screens are likely to be seen by all users installing desktop systems. Translators should avoid jargon in these translations.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The exim4 package installs the Exim Mail Transport Agent (MTA). It is installed by default on all newly installed Debian GNU/Linux systems as Exim has always been the default Debian MTA (even if other MTA may be used and installed later by the system administrator).
It is installed and configured from base-config which triggers some of its configuration steps and thus involves user input.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintainer currently does no use any public CVS or SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the exim4 package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The translation of some exim4 user input screens may be tricky.

More particularly, the screen giving the choice between all possible types of configurations is not easy to handle for translators. Each individual choice contains a description of what this choice means: this must be kept shorter than 72 characters, otherwise, the display will be cut on most screens.

Translators should also try to keep the long description of this specific screen as short as possible and still be clear and avoid jargon. This screen will be shown on every installation, even default ones (which are very likely to be used by low skilled users).
